thread.title: Russian artistes enliven Dasehra fest

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Russian artistes enliven Dasehra fest
text:
Our Correspondent
Kullu, October 23
Performances by national and international dancers enthralled the audience at the first cultural night at Kala Kendra during the week-long International Kullu Dasehra festival, which commenced from yesterday. The festival will witness performances by Bollywood singers, besides many other famous star performers each evening. Governor Acharya Devvrat inaugurated the International Folk Dance Festival Kullu Dasehra by lighting a lamp at Lal Chand Prarthi Kala Kendra last evening. The programme commenced with the local ‘Natti’ and local artistes presented traditional songs, which were a major attraction for the foreign and domestic visitors. Later ‘sufi’ singer Mamta Sharma took the stage and her songs mesmerised the audience. The dance performance by Russian artistes with fire and water left the audience spellbound. The presentation by artists from Sri Lanka also presented a glimpse of the culture of their country. The audience was delighted to see performance by artistes from Kirgizstan. The presentations by artistes from West Bengal and Assam were also spectacular. The students of Bharat Bharati School presented a dance to reflect the life of Lord Buddha. Huge crowd had gathered at the Kala Kendra to witness the first cultural evening. Hundreds of foreign and domestic tourists, besides a large number of local residents gathered to watch the spectacular performances by international and national artists. Chairman of the Kullu Dusshera Festival Committee and Ayurveda and Cooperative minister Karan Singh was the chief guest during various sport events. A literary seminar was held a Devsadan today which was attended by many poets and writers. Litterateur Surat Thakur thanked the Deputy Commissioner for promoting the seminar, which was being organised for the past three years by the Kullu Dasehra Festival Committee.
